thread.title: Magpie Café to open second location in downtown Baton Rouge next spring
thread.title_full: Magpie Café to open second location in downtown Baton Rouge next spring

title: Magpie Café to open second location in downtown Baton Rouge next spring
text:
Magpie Café to open second location in downtown Baton Rouge next spring Magpie Café to open second location in downtown Baton Rouge next spring Advocate staff photo by RICHARD ALAN HANNON -- James Jacobs Jr., left, co-owner of Magpie Cafe, speaks at an in-store coffee demonstration. The shop has expanded its menu offerings and will open a downtown location in spring 2016. george morris | gmorris@theadvocate.com Comments 
Magpie Café plans to open a second location in spring of 2016 in a ground-floor space in The Commerce Building located at 333 Laurel St. in downtown Baton Rouge. 
Magpie Café will be the first retail tenant in a building that also will include apartments, the building’s owners announced Wednesday. 
The restaurant will occupy more than 2,800 square feet and feature a similar menu to Magpie’s Perkins Road overpass. The wellness-centric hot spot opened in 2012 and features house-baked breakfast and lunch options, espresso and coffee. 
“From the initial meeting with Michael Lang and his team [of The Commerce Building], it was evident that the Commerce Building project was a great opportunity to bring the Magpie brand of specialty coffee and local seasonal foods to the resurging downtown area,” James and Lina Jacobs, Magpie Café owners, said in a press release.
